clinical_study.brief_title: Effect Alveolar Recruitment Manoeuver on Stroke Volume a Randomized Study
clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Effect of Alveolar Recruitment Manoeuver Through Stepwise Increase and Decrease in Irway Pressure or Sustained 30 Secondes 30 cmH2O Continuous Positive Airway Pressure. A Randomized Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: to compare the effect of alveolar recruitment manouver through stepwise increase and decrease in airway pressure or sustained 30 secondes 30 cmH2O continuous positive airway pressure on cardiac stroke volume estimated by oesophageal doppler in preload independent anesthetized patients scheduled for surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Following anesthesia and preload optimisation guided by cardiac stroke volume, patients will be randomised to one alveolr recruitment manoeuver :
- stepwise increase and decrease in positive airway pressure
- sustained 30 secondes 30 cmH2O continuous positive airway pressure The primary objective is the change in cardiac stroke volume.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: randomised parallel groups. randomisation between 2 groups equilibated by randomised blocks of 4, 6 or 8
study_design_info.masking_description: The patient will not know the allocation group because he will be anesthetised before randomisation. The care provider (anesthetist) will not know the allocation group because the intervention will be applied by an independent investigator not involved in care of the patient.

primary_outcome.description: change in cardiac stroke volume during the alveolar recruitment manoeuver

secondary_outcome.description: change in arterial pressure during the alveolar recruitment manoeuver
recovery of cardiacstroke volume and arterial pressure 3 min after the end of alveolar recruitment manoeuver

arm_group.description: a 30 secondes 30 cmH2O continuous positive airway pressure applied after the orotracheal intubation will be checked and secured following induction of general anesthesia

a stepwise increase (+5 cmH2O) in postivie airway pressure from +5 cmH2O to +30 cmH2O and decrease (-5 cmH2O) from +30 cmH2O to +5 cmH2O applied after the orotracheal intubation will be checked and secured following induction of general anesthesia

intervention.description: alveolar recruitment manoeuver are recommended during general anesthesia to prevent pulmonary atelectasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients scheduled for major surgery requiring hemodynamic monitoring
- written signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- non sinusal heart rate
- known cardiac right ventricular failure or arterial pulmonary hypertension
- pneumothorax
- known pulmonary emphysema
